md:
giải nghĩa từ "stations" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan và các từ trái nghĩa.

* Stations (n) - Trạm, ga:
	+ Meaning: A place where trains, buses, or other vehicles stop to let people get on or off.
	+ Example: The train station is very crowded during rush hour.
	+ Related words: bus station, train station, subway station, gas station.
	+ Antonyms: departure, destination.

* Stations (n) - Điểm, vị trí:
	+ Meaning: A place where someone or something is located or positioned.
	+ Example: The police officer is stationed at the corner of the street.
	+ Related words: military station, police station, weather station, research station.
	+ Antonyms: movement, migration.

* Stations (v) - Đặt, bố trí:
	+ Meaning: To place or position someone or something in a particular location.
	+ Example: The company stationed its employees in different parts of the city.
	+ Related words: stationing, stationed, stationer.
	+ Antonyms: remove, relocate.
html:
giải nghĩa từ "stations" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan và các từ trái nghĩa.

  • Stations (n) - Trạm, ga:

    • Meaning: A place where trains, buses, or other vehicles stop to let people get on or off.
    • Example: The train station is very crowded during rush hour.
    • Related words: bus station, train station, subway station, gas station.
    • Antonyms: departure, destination.

  • Stations (n) - Điểm, vị trí:

    • Meaning: A place where someone or something is located or positioned.
    • Example: The police officer is stationed at the corner of the street.
    • Related words: military station, police station, weather station, research station.
    • Antonyms: movement, migration.

  • Stations (v) - Đặt, bố trí:

    • Meaning: To place or position someone or something in a particular location.
    • Example: The company stationed its employees in different parts of the city.
    • Related words: stationing, stationed, stationer.
    • Antonyms: remove, relocate.
